definition[0]: (1975–) a British football player who has played for Manchester United, Preston North End, Real Madrid, A.C. Milan, Los Angeles Galaxy, and Paris Saint-Germain. He was captain of the England national team from 2001 until 2006, and is one of the richest and most famous footballers in the world. He appears in many magazines, advertisements, and posters. He was awarded an OBE in 2003. His wife, Victoria, is a singer and used to be a member of the Spice Girls group, and is known as Posh Spice. The couple are often referred to in the British press as ‘Posh ’n' Becks’.
